replies.message: Too bad they burned it down. Well not too bad.
My guess is Marshall might've wanted to move on with his life. If so, then I don't blame him. Telling from some of the songs he had out, there were some bad memories.

I've heard the same thing. It sounds believable, but it was also a condemned building, so the city mighta just done it anyway. Besides, I wouldn't be surprised if he wanted to of kept it. Yeah there were memories, but memories are worth keeping, good or bad

I would of loved to seen this house Eminem is a legend and just to sit at the place where he came up with such great ideas and music would of been an honor. He is the best and will always be the best rapper he made history and he deserves so much for what he has done for people threw his music. I'm upset they burned the house  down I wanted to see it
